page.title: 08SHEEP
page.content: The land around{Grosmont}is very hilly and rises on the{Graig mountain}as high as 352m and is very good for sheep.Nearly all the farms in this area raise sheep.But the number varies acording to the size of the farm from about 100 - 650.The breeds include {Suffolks,Suffolk Crosses,Texels,Mules, {Radnors,Dorset Horn and Welsh Crosses. {The lambing season}starts just before Christmas and goes on well into the Spring.The farmer has to spend a lot of time with the animals during the lambing season and sometimes his wife has to care for the{motherless lambs. {Shearing}is another busy time for the farmer.Shepherds,also,have routine jobs throughout the year,such as regular{drenching}to control worms and {dipping}to control flies striking the sheep.
